titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Captain Freeman H. Smith Family Letters BCMS.0014

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:10 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Captain Freeman H. Smith Family Letters
did.abstract: Captain Freeman H. Smith was a whaler who died at sea in 1855. This collection consists of correspondence between his widow Agnes and son Arthur to Joseph Wickham Case, who administered his estate.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The letters are arranged chronologically within the folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Eleven letters from Agnes and Arthur Smith to Joseph Wickham Case, who administered the estate of Captain Freeman H. Smith, a whaler who died at sea in 1855. The letters date from 1863 to 1865 and are stored in one folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as The Captain Freeman H. Smith Family Letters, Brooklyn Public Library â€“ Brooklyn Collection.
